channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump blasts out bevy of threats against Apple and the EU, saying imported iPhones face a 25% hike
item.description: Writing on Truth Social, President Trump put pressure on both Apple and the EU to get behind his 'America First' policy.

item.title: New Studies Dismiss Signs of Life on Distant Planet
item.description: In April, astronomers said they had detected a possible signature of life on the exoplanet K2-18b. Now, three independent analyses discount the eviden...

item.title: People danced in the streets of Damascus after Trump vowed to end all sanctions on Syria. His administration is unsure how best to proceed
item.description: The country's transition government is reportedly weeks away from "collapse and a full-scale civil war" as ISIS waits in the wings.

item.title: Kermit the Frog’s sage advice for new grads: ‘Rather than jumping over someone to get what you want, consider reaching out your hand… life is better when we leap together’
item.description: Jim Henson, the creator of the Muppets and Kermit the Frog, graduated from the University of Maryland in 1960.

item.title: Harvard Sues Trump Administration Over Move to Bar International Students
item.description: Less than 24 hours earlier, the Trump administration had said it would block current and future international students from attending the university.

item.title: Trump ‘reverse Robin Hood’ tax bill is driving up the cost of buying a home, Democrats say
item.description: "Trump and Republicans are directly responsible for the spike in the 30-year Treasury bond yield and mortgage rates,” said the fourth highest ranking ...

item.title: Inside Trump’s Crypto Dinner, and Kennedy’s Plan to ‘Make America Healthy Again’
3 key takeaways from RFK Jr.’s controversial MAHA report that could change America
item.description: Increased scrutiny of childhood vaccines—credited with saving millions of people from deadly diseases— figures prominently in the report.

item.title: New Studies Dismiss Signs of Life on Distant Planet
item.description: In April, astronomers said they had detected a possible signature of life on the exoplanet K2-18b. Now, three independent analyses discount the eviden...

item.title: Markets Drop on Trump’s Latest Tariff Threats
item.description: President Trump said he would impose steep tariffs on goods from the European Union and targeted Apple with a tax on foreign-made iPhones.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia Begin Largest Exchange of Prisoners of War
item.description: Each side reported that 390 of its people had been returned, and more swaps are expected this weekend.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia Begin Largest Exchange of Prisoners of War
item.description: Each side reported that 390 of its people had been returned, and more swaps are expected this weekend.

item.title: In ‘Cancer Alley,’ a Battle Over Who Gets to Measure Air Pollution
item.description: Community groups are fighting an unusual Louisiana law that restricts how they use data from air-quality monitors, saying it violates free speech.

item.title: Bangladesh’s Leader Threatens to Resign Over Election Pressure
item.description: Muhammad Yunus has struggled to navigate between the army, career politicians and the protest movement that overthrew the country’s authoritarian lead...

item.title: Trump Threatens 50% Tariff on E.U. and 25% Tariff on Apple
item.description: The president threatened both Apple and the European Union with higher tariffs on social media Friday morning, saying that trade talks with the Europe...
